model

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Map
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Level0Map

    public abstract class Map
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This is the abstract Map class that all our concrete maps for each level will inherit from. All Map objects contain instance variables and methods that allow them to serve as the fundamental unit for the gamestate's model, representing the location of all towers and enemies and connecting every element to each other. Locations are being stored as Point objects (-y,x), or (rowsDown, column), representing coordinates to the squares in the grid from a Cartesian viewpoint. Instance Variables: long serialVersionUID - For Serializable interface Tile[][] grid - A 2-D array of Tile objects to model the game map as a grid Image img - The background image of the map, determined by mapType LinkedList enemyPath - A list of all of the path coordinates enemies will pass through Point firstPathTile - The path tile on which enemies spawn Point lastPathTile - The path tile on which enemies stop and do damage to health int currentEnemies - The current total amount of enemies on the map String mapType - A description of the map level, can be used for theme differentiation int mapTypeCode - A code # to differentiate each level Player player - The associated Player object playing this map ArrayList enemies - A list of all the enemies currently on the map ArrayList towers - A list of all the towers currently placed on the map Methods: Map(Tile[][] gridDimensions, LinkedList path, String mapType, Image background, int mapTypeCode, Player player) boolean spawnEnemy(Enemy enemy) boolean updateEnemyPosition(Enemy enemy) void removeDeadEnemy(Point location, Enemy enemy) void lostHealth(int hpLost) void gainedGold(int goldGained) boolean addTower(Tower gym, Point location) void removeTower(Tower gym)
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Peter Hanson
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Map

        public Map(Tile[][] gridDimensions,
   java.util.LinkedList<java.awt.Point> path,
   java.lang.String mapType,
   java.awt.Image background,
   int mapTypeCode,
   Player player)
        Constructs the Map object and initializes and populates some instance variables.
        Parameters:
        gridDimensions - A 2D Tile array with the desired dimensions for the map grid
        path - A list of the coordinates along the grid through which enemies will pass
        mapType - A description of the map's level
        background - The background image of the map to be displayed in the GUI
        mapTypeCode - The level number of this map, can be used to differentiate map events according to level
        player - The Player object associated with who is playing this map

    • Method Detail

      • spawnEnemy

        public boolean spawnEnemy(Enemy enemy)
        Adds an enemy Pokemon to this map, sets its location to the first tile in the enemy path, and adds it to the map's enemies list.
        Parameters:
        enemy - The pokemon to be spawned
        Returns:
        boolean, true if successful, false if not

      • updateEnemyPosition

        public boolean updateEnemyPosition(Enemy enemy)
        Updates an enemy pokemon's position from the current path tile to the next one. To be called by the Pokemon in its own thread every x seconds/movement. Currently enemies can only move 1 discrete square along the grid at a time in this model.
        Parameters:
        enemy - The Pokemon whose position is to be updated
        Returns:
        true if the movement was successful, false if not.

      • removeDeadEnemy

        public void removeDeadEnemy(java.awt.Point location,
                   Enemy enemy)
        Removes a dead enemy Pokemon from both the tile it was on at death and the Map's enemies list. To be called by the Pokemon on death.
        Parameters:
        location - The enemy Pokemon's location at death
        enemy - The dead enemy Pokemon to remove from the Map

      • lostHealth

        public void lostHealth(int hpLost)
        Called by the last Tile along the enemy path when an enemy gets to it. Passes on the amount of hp lost, based on the attacking Pokemon's AttackPower. Map then passes this along to the Player object keeping track of the HP.
        Parameters:
        hpLost - The amount of HP to lose, based on attacking Pokemon's AttackPower.

      • gainedGold

        public void gainedGold(int goldGained)
        Called by any enemy Pokemon that dies, passing its bounty worth. Map just passes on this information to the Player object keeping track of the gold.
        Parameters:
        goldGained - The amount of gold to gain, based on killed Pokemon's Worth.

      • addTower

        public boolean addTower(Tower tower,
               java.awt.Point location)
        Attempts to add a Gym tower to a given location on the map.
        Parameters:
        tower - The Gym tower to be added.
        location - The location to add the Gym tower to.
        Returns:
        true if successful (no preexisting tower there and not part of path) or false if tower cannot be placed.

      • removeTower

        public void removeTower(Tower tower)
        Removes a Gym tower from the Map. Unfinished, may be useful for resale feature.
        Parameters:
        tower - The Gym tower to be removed.

      • getEnemies

        public java.util.ArrayList<Enemy> getEnemies()

      • tick

        public void tick()
